title: Can a spouse be held liable for debts incurred after legal separation is filed
question: I got separated and I live in CA. I am not legally separated yet and now I need to file for Bankruptcy. I heard that my husband is drowning himself to debt with his credit cards. Can I include his debt even though the card is not under my name? I know that in CA Law, if you are not legally separated, technically you owe half of what he owes. Can I file his debts and can I be protected on his future debts when I'm ready to file for legal separation?
question_tags: Divorce,Alternatives to divorce,Legal separation and divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy means test,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Spousal debt,Marriage
answers:
If you and he are still married and if you qualify on the Means Test (household income at or under the state median), you can file a joint petition and include all the debts you both owe.

I would strongly suggest that you contact a local bankrutpcy attorney to see what is feasible.
